definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
lit. a meteor catching up with the moon/swift action (idiom)

pinyin: lie4 hu4 zuo4 liu2 xing1 yu3

sentences.english: Many of Meteor Shower's ads fall in that category.
sentences.chinese: 《流星雨》中的很多广告就分属此类。

sentences.english: And it's from meteoroids that we get meteors and meteorites.
sentences.chinese: 流星和陨石也是来自流星体中。

sentences.english: And it's from meteoroids that we get meteors and meteorites.
sentences.chinese: 流星和陨石也是来自流星体中。

sentences.english: The cometary ejection play a crucial role in formation and evolution of the meteoroid stream.
sentences.chinese: 彗星的喷发速度在流星群的演化过程中起着重要作用。

sentences.english: Embracing by glamorous light, the meteor is under the wings of Cupid.
sentences.chinese: 被一群光芒所包围的流星，是被爱神翅膀所保护的。

sentences.english: The teacher came striding into the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 老师大步流星地走进教室。

sentences.english: Meteor finished with the long-tail again across the dark night sky.
sentences.chinese: 说完流星带着长长的光尾再次划过漆黑的夜空。

sentences.english: Observers under dark skies could see up to 20 meteors per hour.
sentences.chinese: 暗夜里的观测者每小时最多可见到20颗流星。

sentences.english: When a meteoroid enters the atmosphere, it compresses the air in front of it.
sentences.chinese: 当流星体进入大气层，它压缩的空气在前面的。

sentences.english: Wringting of light assaut the darkness, more prodigious thanmeteors .
sentences.chinese: 光明的文字划过黑暗，比流星更为神奇。

sentences.english: Studies on meteoroid streams are briefly and systematically presented.
sentences.chinese: 对流星群的研究作了简明而系统的介绍。

sentences.english: I am a meteor, a heart from your fingers fiery stars star.
sentences.chinese: 我是一颗流星，一颗从你指间一瞬即逝的星。

sentences.english: Countle meteoroids will be sent hurtling into the Earth's atmo here at 71 kilometres a second.
sentences.chinese: 无数流星将以每秒71公里的速度划破长空。

sentences.english: Recent Jovian impact probably came from a giant meteorite.
sentences.chinese: 最近木星陨撃可能来自一巨大流星体。

sentences.english: Maybe along the way I can check the meteoroids.
sentences.chinese: 没准我顺便还可以研究研究那流星群。

sentences.english: In the northern hemisphere, this meteor shower should be observed 3 hours before sunrise.
sentences.chinese: 在北半球，本次流星雨应在日出前3小时投入观测。

definition: silvery light/bright white light/shining white light
(of a meteor etc) to streak across (the sky)/(of a searchlight, lightning etc) to play across (the sky)
